title: Crunchy Baked Tilapia
summary: Crunchy Baked Tilapia requires approximately 20 minutes from start to finish. One serving contains 1219 calories, 80g of protein, and 76g of fat. This recipe serves 1 and costs $7.72 per serving. This recipe from Recipezaar has 1 fans. A mixture of saltine crackers, tilapia, ground pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the saltine crackers you could follow this main course with the Caramel Crack Candy Ice Cream as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. Overall, this recipe earns a solid spoonacular score of 75%. Similar recipes include Crunchy Baked Tilapia, Crunchy Oven Fried Tilapia, and Crunchy Potato Chip Tilapia, Salt N Vinegar.

winePairing.pairingText: Tilapia can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: Preheat oven to 400FMelt butter in shallow pie dish; set aside.In another shallow dish, mix cracker crumbs, seasoning and spices.Dry fillets and dredge in butter; then, in crumb-seasonings mixture.Place on oil-sprayed foil-lined baking sheet and distribute remaining crumbs on tops of fillets.Drizzle remaining melted butter over crumbs.Sprinkle each with grated cheese.Bake for 15-20 minutes, until fish flakes easily and topping is golden.Serve with Chili SauceII-Recipe #7161, if desired.Enjoy!

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400FMelt butter in shallow pie dish; set aside.In another shallow dish, mix cracker crumbs, seasoning and spices.Dry fillets and dredge in butter; then, in crumb-seasonings mixture.
Place on oil-sprayed foil-lined baking sheet and distribute remaining crumbs on tops of fillets.
Drizzle remaining melted butter over crumbs.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until fish flakes easily and topping is golden.
Serve with Chili SauceII-Recipe #7161, if desired.Enjoy!
